intro: Schwantesia succumbens, commonly known as the succulent spurge, is a species of flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its fleshy, succulent leaves and stems adapted to arid environments. The plant produces small, inconspicuous greenish-yellow flowers clustered in cyathia, which are typical of the Euphorbiaceae family. Schwantesia succumbens thrives in well-drained soil and requires minimal water, making it suitable for xeriscaping. Its ornamental value lies in its unique foliage and ability to withstand harsh environmental conditions.
